channel.title: Looking to Spend £650 - 800
channel.description:
im looking for a desktop pc, excluding monitor.
i will be mainly playing games, internet, music and films on it.
if possible, can you use www.ebuyer.com, i have a general idea but i would like to see what you come up with
thanks in advance! ollie.

[/quote]
what do you guys download, porn?[/quote]

Games for computer and Wii.

item.title: Looking to Spend £650 - 800
item.dc:creator: @R.I.P_RSC R.I.P RSC
item.description:
@R.I.P_RSC wrote:

So I can burn them to a dvd, and watch it on my tv instead of my laptop. I usually download a complete, retail rip. This way I get the complete (well not always, sometimes without extra’s) dvd.

I like subtitles, and with xvid/divx you usually get custom subtitles, and they are either bad translations or not synchronized.

Read full topic

item.title: Looking to Spend £650 - 800
item.dc:creator: @Ollie Ollie
item.description:
@Ollie wrote:

[quote=“R.I.P RSC, post:21, topic:245296”]A dvd5 is a normal, single layer dvd, not a dual layer and certainly not a blueray disk.

en.wikipedia.org

DVD

DVD (an abbreviation of digital versatile disc) is a digital optical disc storage format invented and developed in 1995. The medium can store any kind of digital data and is widely used for software and other computer files as well as video programs watched using DVD players. DVDs offer higher storage capacity than compact discs while having the same dimensions. Prerecorded DVDs are mass-produced using molding machines that physically stamp data onto the DVD. Such discs are a form of DVD-ROM bec...

Ollie:

unless you are talking about un-encoded files

which you are… and i dont know why you wouldn’t encode them xvid or x264

Read full topic

item.title: Looking to Spend £650 - 800
item.dc:creator: @R.I.P_RSC R.I.P RSC
item.description:
@R.I.P_RSC wrote:

1 DVD5 is 4.7gb, so 10 would be 47 gig. Add a few albums, a game, and voila, you have successfully filled 60GB.

I’m currently trying to fill 1 TB with films and music, but it’s hard.

I’d like to add the following, as a question to those who ask why anyone would need 1TB: Why not? It’s almost the same price as a smaller HD, there as fast as smaller ones (although it might be better to buy 2 500GB HD’s) and it’s ready for the future. Games/Movies are increasing in size, so you’ll need a bigger HD soon.

Read full topic

item.title: Looking to Spend £650 - 800
item.dc:creator: @The_Un-Named The Un-Named
item.description:
@The_Un-Named wrote:

If you’re looking for a nice 22" monitor, I have a IIyama ProLite E2201W, I decided to buy it because of this and have been pleased with it since I got the colour setup properly. I have my computer plugged into it using the old CRT cables, and my PS3 is connected using a HDMI <> DVI cable. Works very well, except I have to have the sound going through my computer. (Using a VGA cable and VGA > stereo jack plugged into line in).

Read full topic

item.title: Looking to Spend £650 - 800
item.dc:creator: @Ollie Ollie
item.description:
@Ollie wrote:

xEnt:

pay 70$ extra and get a 9800GT at least, well worth it.

no need, id rather save the £40

Unhandled:

You can get a 22" LCD monitor for about £110. I have an Acer AL2216W, and it’s friggin awesome.

the samsung 20" is good contrast ratio, and small ms, i would rather have a samsung with better stats than a bigger screen with slightly worse for the sake of £10

but thanks anyway, i will look into that Acer screen @ specs n shiz

Read full topic

item.description:
@Ollie wrote:

yes, i would probably build it myself i think, and i would wait until after Christmas to buy it all (will reduce price by up to £100)

p.s. thanks, this looks like a good machine[br][br][size=1]Posted on: November 21, 2008, 11:13:03 am[/size][hr]2 Case: Antec 300 Three Hundred Case - No PSU
CD/DVD Drive: LG GSA-H58N 20x DVD±RW DL & RAM IDE Black Bare Drive - OEM

Memory: Corsair 4GB Kit (2x2GB) DDR2 800MHz/PC2-6400 XMS2 Memory Non-ECC Unbuffered CL5 Lifetime Warranty
Motherboard: Asus P5Q PRO P45 Socket 775 8 Channel Audio ATX Motherboard
PSU: Corsair 650W TX Series PSU - 120mm Fan, 80+% Efficiency, Single +12V Rail
Processor: Intel Core 2 Quad Q9400 Socket 775 2.66GHz 1333FSB 6MB Cache Retail Boxed Processor
Monitor: Samsung SM2023NW 20"TFT Monitor 1680x1050 1000:1 300cd/m2 5ms VGA Silver/Black 3 Years On-Site Warranty
Keyboard: Hiper Alloy Black Aluminium Keyboard with Multimedia Hot Keys USB
Mouse: Do Not Need

Price: £759.98

i decided i would need a monitor, my desk is not big enough for my old crt!

item.title: Looking to Spend £650 - 800
item.dc:creator: @Tico135 Tico
item.description:
@Tico135 wrote:

Really, you’re better off to build it yourself, whether or not you are into that stuff or whatever. Additionally, I highly suggest waiting a few weeks (possibly 1-3) for the Christmas specials to go on, as you will likely save quite a bit of money there.

If you are looking for a pre-built computer, I found this desktop on the site you suggested, which actually looks pretty decent: http://www.ebuyer.com/product/151919. In the first few words it matches pretty much what you are looking for.

Gaming, movies, office, photo and video editing

Read full topic
